comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of May 3, 1914, reports on the cardinal leaving Baltimore for New York, whence he would sail for Europe to visit the Pope. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9803EFD81E39E633A... It reports that he would sail on the Prinzess[in] Irene with the Rev. Louis R. Stickney.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The Baltimore Archbishop got there okay: the New York Times of May 27, 1914, reports that Cardinal Gibbons, in Rome, on May 26 hosted a dinner for sixty; his guests included ten cardinals: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9902E3DC1F39E6... While in Rome, Gibbons paid a farewill visit to the dying Pope Pius X (who described himself as a permanent exile from his beloved Venice). In July 1914, after Pius died, Gibbons had to make a return visit to Rome for the Conclave that elected the next Pope, Benedict XV.
